channel.title: Gustav Janssons devlog
channel.description: This blog is a try to me keep motivates and a way to see my progress on my current projects. Let’s see how it goes!

item.title: Week 42
item.description: This week I completed my entry for the spelsylt gamejam.

item.title: Week 41
item.description: This week I worked on the kodsnack spelsylt gamejam. Another week unti it finishes and the progress is pretty great.

item.title: Week 40
item.description: This week I continued work on ride, adding input and started on unit tests.

item.title: Week 39
item.description: This week I continued working on ride. Most of the selection is done and I’ve just started on text input.

item.title: Week 38
item.description: This week I continued working on ride.

item.title: Week 37
item.description: Theese past few weeks I have been moving to a new apparment and I’m finally getting back to coding again. This past week I’ve been gettng back into ride from scratch and finally have some progress. I can render text and scroll!

item.title: Week 32
item.description: This week I continued working on ride and started porting lite to C++ so I can get a better handle on how I want to structure ride.

item.title: Week 31
item.description: This week I worked on xml loading and error handling in gaf and integrating it in euphoria. Still missing XSD generation and more testing needs to be done but for now it seems to be working, allowing me to continue working on tred.

item.title: Week 30
item.description: This week I continued working on gaf, the new xml loading is almost complete

item.title: Week 29
item.description: This week I continued the work on jsonh and gaf. Jsonh almost seems ready for a 2.0 version, but I might also deprecated it and replace it with a xml loader instead as xml both provide xpath and xsd that will aid when writing files.

item.title: Week 28
item.description: This week I continued work on my json library and updated the gaf compiler to c++

item.title: Week 27
item.description: This week I moved all of my todos for euphoria from trello to the github issues, now people can see the current plan. I also continued on the next version of my json library. Hopefully it won’t take long to complete and I can start using it in my engine

item.title: Week 26
item.description: This week I worked on cleaning up git commits and using better commit messages.

item.title: Week 25
item.description: This week I continued on cleaning up euphoria

item.title: Week 24
item.description: This week I continued on refactoring and code health for euphoria. Still got a few errors and warnings to take care of :)
